Description: This folio from Walters manuscript W.617 contains a colophon witten in Arabic in red Nasta'liq. The colophon gives the place and the date of copying.
Inscriptions: [Transliteration]  qad waqa'a al-farāgh min tahrīrih wa- /1/ tastīrih b-'awn Allāh al-malik /2/ al-'azīz al-'alīm wa-husn tawfīqih /3/ fī yawm al-thulathā ghurrat Rabī al-awwal /4/ sanat arba' wa-thalathīn wa-tis'imi<'>ah al-hijrīyah /5/ al-nabawīyah al-mustafawīyah hāmidan li-Llāh wa-musalliyan /6 / wa-musalliman 'alá Sayyid al-'ālimīn wa-qablahu /7/ al-'āshiqīn wa-al-'ārifīn Muhammad al-mustafá /8 / al-amīn wa-ālih wa-ahibbā'ih wa-atbā'ih ajma'īn /9/ al-tayyibīn al-tāhirīn fī al-buq'ah /10 / al-rafī'ah al-rūzbihānīyah qaddasa /11 /sirr sākinihā min a'ālī biqā' al-Shīrāz harasahu Allāh min jamī' al-āfāt /12/ wa-al-'āhāt wa-al-balīyāt /13/
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Safavid; Book; Calligraphy; Codex; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript;  Iran; Literature -- Poetry; Literature -- Prose
Medium: ink and pigments on cream-colored laid paper
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Title: Colophon
